settings.title: Ultra-Strong, Rust-Proof Steel Pergolas
settings.paragraph:
To ensure the longevity of our pergolas, we rely on galvanized steel throughout the structure. We also carefully analyze potential weak spots and areas that could accumulate moisture, then reinforce the overall strength of the pergola with powder-coated hardware that can withstand exposure to the elements. 

  • Galvanized steel beams and posts
  • Powder-coated hardware and anchoring plates
  • Thicker metal walls than competitors to ensure stability

settings.title: Wind Resistant Metal Pergolas
settings.paragraph:
Our pergolas undergo rigorous testing to certify they can withstand even the most extreme weather conditions, including winds up to 100 mph* — and we have numerous customer stories attesting to the safety and security of our pergolas during hurricane-force winds. This level of performance is possible for several reasons.

  • We use a thick steel gauge, which adds weight and helps keep the pergola grounded. 
  • Powder-coated steel anchoring plates with four 2" concrete screws securely fasten the structure to your property. 
  • Our all-metal design ensures that no loose parts fly off during severe winds.

settings.title: Electrical Outlets to Power Your Lifestyle
settings.paragraph:
Our pergolas offer limitless possibilities for use thanks to our exclusive PowerPort™. Featuring three surge-protected USB ports and three electrical outlets protected in a weather-resistant closure, it allows you to enhance your pergola experience by supplying power for lighting, music, mixers, and any other plug-in devices. 

Plus, it’s easily moveable! On our metal pergolas, the PowerPort™is held in place by strong magnets on the back of the housing, so you can place it on any of the posts and quickly relocate it if needed.

settings.title: PRO-TECT® Certified
settings.paragraph: To ensure we’ve engineered the best possible pergola for you, we’ve tested each of our designs to certify that they achieve the absolute highest standards in the industry.

settings.title: Weak, lightweight aluminum structures
settings.content:
• Aluminum is often touted for being lighter than steel. This is true, but that lower weight comes with weaker performance. 
  • Aluminum posts and beams are much more likely to dent than steel. This can happen during installation with simple mishandling or dropping a tool. Additionally, natural events like hail, fallen branches, etc., can easily leave an impression on the aluminum. 
  • Steel is heavier than aluminum because it has a higher concentration of carbon — that’s also what makes steel stronger and more resilient.

settings.title: Wind-resistance claims that haven’t been tested
settings.content:
• Never trust a wind resistance claim that hasn’t been certified. 
  • Wind resistance is difficult to test. It requires a great deal of effort and cost from the manufacturer to replicate hurricane-force winds to determine when a pergola becomes unstable. We are happy to make that investment because we want to keep your structure and family safe. 
  • If it hasn’t been tested, it may just be a best guess at wind resistance. And a structure that weighs several hundred pounds is not something you want to guess about when the wind picks up

settings.title: Low-quality footings that absorb moisture and weaken over time
settings.content:
• Where your pergola touches the ground is the most likely spot where decay, rot, and other structural problems can easily seep into the posts. 
  • Footings are one particular area that many pergolas fail to recognize — we know that strong footings make a more stable, longer-lasting pergola. Plus, we make ours look good!
  • Our powder-coated steel anchoring plates prevent moisture from being easily absorbed into the posts and provide a safe, effective method for bolting your pergola into pavers or concrete pads.
